Bases: object

close()[source]
static decode(enc: str, to_tensor=False, map_none=0.0)[source]

Decode the encoded string encoding. The decoded output is either a list of floats or a 1d tensor with dim=768

Parameters:

  • enc (str) – Encoded string

  • to_tensor (bool, optional) – whether output the pytorch tensor, defaults to False

  • map_none (float, optional) – the none value would be converted to this-value-fulling tensor/list defaults to 0.0

Returns:

either a list of floats or a 1d tensor

Return type:

either a list of floats or a 1d tensor

decode_col(df: DataFrame, col='enc', map_none=0)[source]

Decode the colomn of the dataframe

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe to be decoded in place

  • col (str, optional) – the column to be decoded, defaults to “enc”

  • map_none (int, optional) – the none value would be converted to this value, defaults to 0 (under development)

Returns:

decoded tensor

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

load_edge(src_index_col, src_mapping, dst_index_col, dst_mapping, encoders=None, **kwargs)[source]
load_hetero_graph_dataset(node_labels: list, include_mapping=True) → HeteroData[source]

load_node(cypher, index_col, encoders=None, **kwargs)[source]

_summary_

Parameters:

  • cypher (string) – input cypher to query nodes

  • index_col (string) – index_columns in the returned dataframe

  • encoders (string, optional) – name or directory path for sentence encoder, defaults to None. If none, would use the default.

Returns:

x (the decoded (None, 768) tensor), mapping (the name-to-index dict)

Return type:

torch.Tensor, dict
